citation.article-title: Reclassification of Eubacterium formicigenerans Holdeman and Moore 1974 as Dorea formicigenerans gen. nov., comb. nov., and description of Dorea longicatena sp. nov., isolated from human faeces.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Dorea longicatena sp. nov.
Dorea longicatena (lon.gi.ca.te'na. L. adj. longus long; L. fem. n. catena chain; N.L. fem. n. longicatena long chain, referring to the long chains that this organism develops in culture medium)
Gram-positive rods that are obligately anaerobic, nonmotile and non-spore-forming.
Individual cells are 0.5-0.6 μm wide by 2.0-4.3 μm long and occur in chains of 4-200 cells.
Sometimes cells from old cultures stain Gram-negative.
On Columbia blood and WCA agar, cells form white-opaque colonies that are 1-3 mm in diameter, circular, convex, smooth, shiny and sticky.
Ethanol, formate and acetate are the major products of glucose metabolism.

Acid is produced from D-glucose, D-lactose, D-maltose, D-galactose, amygdalin, L-arabinose, aesculin, D-fructose, D-salicin, D-sorbitol, sucrose, inositol, arbutin, β-gentiobiose, lactulose, D-glucosamine, D-xylose, inulin, fructooligosaccharides, α-D-raffinose (weak), xylitol (weak), D-lyxose (weak) and L-arabitol (weak).

Acid is not produced from DL-arginine, D-arabitol, D-arabinose, D-cellobiose, glycogen, glycerol, erythritol, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, L-sorbose, dulcitol, D-fucose, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, methyl α-D- mannoside, methyl α-D-glucoside, D-turanose, D-mannose, D-mannitol, α-D-melibiose, α-D-melezitose, N-acetylglucosamine, pyruvate, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, starch, D-trehalose, D-tagatose or L-xylose.
Gelatin and hippurate are not hydrolysed.
The G+C content of the DNA is 43.8-45.6 mol%.
